name: Thistle Glasgow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A typical business hotel nicely located in the city. The staff was responsive, courteous and provided information about the city. Parking is pretty decent as you are allowed to exit and return with no extra fee. Overnight parking is 5 pounds.
reviews.title: Nice location

reviews.text: 5 of us stayed over for a 50th birthday celebration and the staff were so friendly. The breakfast was amazing and the chef came round all the tables to make sure everyone was happy. I watched him take a small boy over to the toaster to show him how to make toast. Small I know but the personal touch make me want to o back.
reviews.title: Friendliest staff in glasgow particularly the breakfast chef.

reviews.text: A well located hotel to central Glasgow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I are just back from a 2 night weekend stay. On arrival the car park had plenty spaces. Cost £5 per night. Check in was swift but as we arrived at 11:45 am advised room would not be ready until 2pm. Offered to keep any luggage for us but we just left it in the car and went out to the shops. The location is ideal plenty eating places and shops on your doorstep. Came back at 4pm given key for room on 7th floor. The room was as shown in the photograph, large window and kingsize bed. It was clean and never heard any noise all the time we were there. Swimming pool is adequate with sauna and steam room. Although the hotel was full the pool was quiet. We could not fault the breakfast and the service as in other areas of the hotel was friendly and helpfull. Certain furniture looks a bit worn but as this is a busy city hotel, only natural. Checking out also was not a problem just remember to get your car park ticket at reception.
reviews.title: FRIENDLY HOTEL

reviews.text: Stayed here 1 night on business after a seminar and it's exactly what you'd expect - modern, clean, well equipped rooms, excellent meeting and conference facilities with a surprisingly decent buffet provided for our group of around 300 people. I have no idea what the rate was but probably £££s so best if the company is paying !

reviews.text: Stayed there for two nights , room was reasonably clean, the floral curtains and headboards transported you right back to the eighties ,the room was very tired looking definitely in need of a make over.

reviews.text: The Restaurant was awfull, steak was so fatty I couldn’t chew it , a very expesive plate of potataes and green beans , Jam roly poly , I’m still looking for the jam. Chiken on a bed of potatoes equals one very small potato, Pint of lagar £3.90 , cross the road £2.10 . I won’t be back
reviews.title: Excellent room...very modern and food was excellent!
Okay
reviews.text: Stayed in the thistle on a business trip. I was given a delux double room on the 5th floor which was ver spacious with a flatscreen mounted tv with freeview a seperate table and chairs and a massive double bed. The bathroom was spacious with a very powerful shower (which is the main selling point for me!!). ordered room service two nights and ate out for one. Meals were very good as a treat to yourself and was delivered very quickly. Breakfast was excellent from the staff to the food, staff even remebered my name which is very good customer service.

Staff at in general were excellent. Gym is OK...loads of equipment to get a full workout but not the most state of the art...but with a sauna and steam room AND a swimming pool all at your leasuire as a hotel guest why not?!
reviews.title: Friendly Staff.. Pathetic Room!

reviews.text: My 4 friends and spent the week-end here to celebrate a 50th birthday,will be back, the staff all went that extra mile, couldnt have picked a better hotel, will be back again.
reviews.title: We will be back, best hotel in glasgow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Thistle. All staff really friendly and helpful, absolutely top class in terms of customer service. Leisure club was lovely. Breakfast was very good with very attentive staff and head chef. Couldnt have done enough for us. The room for me was average. All good but maybe a little basic, maybe some extra products in the bathroom and the room would have been good. Would stay here again. Very central.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the leisure, breakfast a++, room could do with a little more extras

description: Thistle Glasgow makes an ideal base for exploring the many galleries, museums and other attractions of Scotland’s second city. We’re also a few minutes walk from Glasgow Central Station, making it the perfect place to get down to business.
